title: Attacker could setup reminder remotely using brute force
vulnerability_information:
Hi,

Attacker could setup the reminder for bulk  no of amount of accounts using there phone no's. He could setup infinite no of reminders. Tried brute force for 100 times worked perfectly
here is the link : https://widgets.uber.com/american-airlines-reminders/
Here any phone-no is accepted. Actually logged in user phone-no should be cross checked.

TCP DUMP while setting up reminder:

```
POST /american-airlines-reminders/api/v1/reminders HTTP/1.1
Host: widgets.uber.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:47.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/47.0
Accept: application/json
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
X-CSRF-Token: 
x-uber-origin: web-reminders
Content-Type: application/json
Referer: https://widgets.uber.com/american-airlines-reminders/
Content-Length: 87
Cookie: 
Connection: keep-alive

{"event":{"time":1470940200},"phone_number":"+919949111969","reminder_time":1470937500}
```

Send that request to intruder in burp and try to brute force. Setting up reminder is always shown with response code 200 .
my reminder was setup on Thu, 11 Aug 2016 17:45:00 GMT multiple times. Attacker could perform this on multiple phone-no.
This could issue for user's because their phone gets constantly notifications.
Regards
prashanth varma

activities.message: There is not much security impact here beyond annoyance and you must have the victims phone number already, which if you wanted to annoy them you could more easily call them a bunch.

activities.message:
Hello team , 

i can see here the fix is implemented but didn't cared to update the ticket ? and no response for previous comments !

>> __There is not much security impact here beyond annoyance and you must have the victim's phone number already, which if you wanted to annoy them you could more easily call them a bunch.__

For this i want to say calling or making annoyance to anyone via phone call is not making uber to responsible but in this case i reported any user or apps can make annoyance with name of __Uber__ and at the end user will uninstall the app, and m very sure uber really don't want that and for same reason fix got implemented but reporter didn't got notified for that which i don't find professional so requesting disclosure here and if that it is the case which uber don't care about actually as issue then will request for granting me permission about writing blog about it ! 

````
{
    "code": "rate_limited", 
    "message": "Exceeded rate limit"
}
````

Hello team ,

i can see here the fix is implemented but didn't cared to update the ticket ? and no response for previous comments !

There is not much security impact here beyond annoyance and you must have the victim's phone number already, which if you wanted to annoy them you could more easily call them a bunch.

For this i want to say calling or making annoyance to anyone via phone call is not making uber to responsible but in this case i reported any user or apps can make annoyance with name of Uber and at the end user will uninstall the app, and m very sure uber really don't want that and for same reason fix got implemented but reporter didn't got notified for that which i don't find professional so requesting disclosure here and if that it is the case which uber don't care about actually as issue then will request for granting me permission about writing blog about it !

    "message": "Exceeded rate limit"
}

activities.message:
You were not notified because: 

1. This ticket was correctly marked this "Not Applicable" a month ago. You will note it was also closed. 
2. We found this bug internally before your submission and deemed it the lowest impact level possible. Sorry I didn't mention this fact before but this is indeed a dupe. 
3. No changes were made as a result of your report. It appears as part of natural code churn an engineer added rate limiting. Most likely the engineer noticed the task we had opened when we found this.  
4. Given a users phone number and the reality of spoofing callerid one could perform equally or more annoying attacks with no involvement from uber or our code.
activities.markdown_message:
You were not notified because:

  1. This ticket was correctly marked this "Not Applicable" a month ago. You will note it was also closed.
  2. We found this bug internally before your submission and deemed it the lowest impact level possible. Sorry I didn't mention this fact before but this is indeed a dupe.
  3. No changes were made as a result of your report. It appears as part of natural code churn an engineer added rate limiting. Most likely the engineer noticed the task we had opened when we found this.
  4. Given a users phone number and the reality of spoofing callerid one could perform equally or more annoying attacks with no involvement from uber or our code.

activities.message:
Hello @notcollin !

it's not about bounty or something else these are my questions for clarifications!

 __This ticket was correctly marked this "Not Applicable" a month ago. You will note it was also closed.__

>> No closing this as NA was not correct as based on decision made by uber here #127918, and i can say this clearly this issue was more severe if we comparting with #127918 as that was sms based and this issue was abusing anyone using uber App itself as i explained before !

__We found this bug internally before your submission and deemed it the lowest impact level possible. Sorry I didn't mention this fact before but this is indeed a dupe.__
>> if that is the , then i rest my case, but at least you should care to reply if an researchers making comment even after u closed the report !

__Given a user's phone number and the reality of spoofing caller id one could perform equally or more annoying attacks with no involvement from uber or our code.__
>> here if am making report to uber for uber app then am more concerned about how uber's property can be misused not what attacks in real can be done with phone numbers !

anyway thanks for clarification @notcollin.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @notcollin !

it's not about bounty or something else these are my questions for clarifications!

This ticket was correctly marked this "Not Applicable" a month ago. You will note it was also closed.

No closing this as NA was not correct as based on decision made by uber here #127918, and i can say this clearly this issue was more severe if we comparting with #127918 as that was sms based and this issue was abusing anyone using uber App itself as i explained before !

We found this bug internally before your submission and deemed it the lowest impact level possible. Sorry I didn't mention this fact before but this is indeed a dupe.

if that is the , then i rest my case, but at least you should care to reply if an researchers making comment even after u closed the report !

Given a user's phone number and the reality of spoofing caller id one could perform equally or more annoying attacks with no involvement from uber or our code.

here if am making report to uber for uber app then am more concerned about how uber's property can be misused not what attacks in real can be done with phone numbers !

anyway thanks for clarification @notcollin.

activities.message:
And one more thing to say, even if it was found internally and got fixed , how __*closing the report as NA*__ is justified by knowing the fact that less severe issue got resolved before #127918 ?
interested to know about it @notcollin .

Thank you.
activities.markdown_message:
And one more thing to say, even if it was found internally and got fixed , how closing the report as NA is justified by knowing the fact that less severe issue got resolved before #127918 ?
interested to know about it @notcollin .

Thank you.

summaries.content: Send repeated reminders to user involved in specific program - found and fixed internally.
summaries.content_html: Send repeated reminders to user involved in specific program - found and fixed internally.

summaries.content:
__*About Bug :*__
>>as far i understand it was valid and more severe issue as compare to decision made by Uber in past  : #127918

__*About Report :*__
>>Uber closed it as NA by saying no or low impact and later fixed if it by saying it was found internally before while public discourse.

__*My Take :*__ 
>>if it fixed and found internally then **NA** is not justified state for the report, where thyself don't know it was found internally before while closing the report.
summaries.content_html:
About Bug :

as far i understand it was valid and more severe issue as compare to decision made by Uber in past : #127918

About Report :

Uber closed it as NA by saying no or low impact and later fixed if it by saying it was found internally before while public discourse.

My Take :

if it fixed and found internally then NA is not justified state for the report, where thyself don't know it was found internally before while closing the report.
